2.text: How long do you afflict my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

3.text: Behold, these ten times you confound me, and are not ashamed to oppress me.

4.text: For if I have been ignorant, my ignorance shall be with me.

5.text: But you have set yourselves up against me, and reprove me with my reproaches.

6.text: At least now understand, that God hath not afflicted me with an equal judgment, and compassed me with his scourges.

7.text: Behold I cry suffering violence, and no one will hear: I shall cry aloud, and there is none to judge.

8.text: He hath hedged in my path round about, and I cannot pass, and in my way he hath set darkness.

9.text: He hath stripped me of my glory, and hath taken the crown from my head.

10.text: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am lost, and he hath taken away my hope, as from a tree that is plucked up.

11.text: His wrath is kindled against me, and he hath counted me as his enemy.

12.text: His troops have come together, and have made themselves a way by me, and have besieged my tabernacle round about.

13.text: He hath put my brethren far from me, and my acquaintance like strangers have departed from me.

14.text: My kinsmen have forsaken me, and they that knew me, have forgotten me.

15.text: They that dwelt in my house, and my maidservants have counted me a stranger, and I have been like an alien in their eyes.

16.text: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer, I entreated him with my own mouth.

17.text: My wife hath abhorred my breath, and I entreated the children of my womb.

18.text: Even fools despise me; and when I gone from them, they spoke against me.

19.text: They that were sometime my counsellors, have abhorred me: and he whom I love most is turned against me.

20.text: The flesh being consumed. My bone hath cleaved to my skin, and nothing but lips are left about my teeth.

21.text: Have pity on me, have pity on me, at least you my friends, because the hand of the Lord hath touched me.

22.text: Why do you persecute me as God, and glut yourselves with my flesh?

23.text: Who will grant me that my words may be written? Who will grant me that they may be marked down in a book?

24.text: With an iron pen and in a plate of lead, or else be graven with an instrument in flint stone.

25.text: For I know that my Redeemer liveth, and in the last day I shall rise out of the earth.

26.text: And I shall be clothed again with my skin, and in my flesh I will see my God.

27.text: Whom I myself shall see, and my eyes shall behold, and not another: this my hope is laid up in my bosom.

28.text: Why then do you say now: Let us persecute him, and let us find occasion of word against him?

29.text: Flee then from the face of the sword, for the sword is the revenger of iniquities: and know ye that there is judgment.
